post.body: I would say so. Teach the blighters a lesson.
Was that after watching Fantabulosa! last night? Missed it again.
RT: Staten Island Historians Piece Together Genealogy Of Wu-Tang Clan http://twurl.nl/p24vy7 - @theonion. LULZ.
I may have been too hasty in lauding Amazon's .mp3 pricing scheme, as even at £3 the new Oasis album is as boring as shit.
Amazon have got their .mp3 pricing right; £3 is a good price to tempt me into buying an album that I might not consider otherwise.
A live action film of We3, from the director of Kung Fu Panda? http://tinyurl.com/55j3zt - I'm not sure how I feel about that. I LOVE We3.
Know of a site that lets you post code for other people to give feedback on? Not to fix code that doesn't work, but to improve what does?
From the "kicking a man when he's down" file: http://tinyurl.com/5u4538
Just seen the phrase "nuking the fridge" used instead of "jumping the shark". Big LOLs.
IE6 use has taken a massive drop in the last year; down to between 6% and 20% on general websites I manage. Still too much, but better.
Wishing the designer hadn't used quite so many different types of rounded corners.
Sweating the details
Working on an actual Windows machine instead of a virtual machine, for the first time in ages. You know, Vista is not that bad.
Convincing myself that spending hours fixing sites to work in IE6 is good for the soul. It isn't easy.
Defending niche markup languages.
The new Google Reader interface is a bit buggy; quite often, read articles don't get marked as read.
New blog post: Five plugins (and a theme) to improve Textpatten http://tinyurl.com/5f8djr
Using lots of border-radius, even though I know a) it's not standard yet & b) i'll have to add extra markup for IE.
... and my favourite track off that album is described as having a "stupidity... that douses all credibility"?
What does it mean if the first album I like by a band is their first to get really bad reviews?
You don't like Windows; I get it.
Once again, my copy of DOM Scripting comes to the rescue. Thanks, @adactio. http://domscripting.com/book/
Blur added a second date, I got my tickets. Foul mood averted.
Just missed out on buying tickets for Blur as nobody told me the door between offices requires a code, and I've been trapped for 20 minutes.
O. M. G. Quantum Leap fan movie: A Leap To Di For. Yes, that 'Di'. http://tinyurl.com/6b73vl
Trying to remember / figure out why I wrote that CSS the way I did.
Wondering what on earth possessed me to not buy cheese when I was at Neal's Yard yesterday.
How the hell does this dictionary not recognise "hasn't"?
Back from a birthday lunch at Roast. Lovely meat, lovely spuds, lovely place. Just lovely.
Twitterrific on my iPod is utterly borked all of a sudden. Anyone else experiencing likewise?
Your bill is now available to view online. *click* Your bill is not available to view at this time.
Trying out the iPlayer application for Adobe Air on Linux.
My friends @B1ip and @jnr have had a baby! Nice one.
Like "Electric Feel" by MGMT? Then you'll love Prince, c. 1980!
